website_summaries.verdict: Works as well as most other products in its class for a significant savings.
pros: A 6-month supply for a reasonable price for a preventative that works well for most pet owners
Results are noticeable for most within 12 hours
cons: Some cats had reactions, such as fur loss and irritation around the applications site
Some owners report a "resistance" to the product over time that reduces its effectiveness for killing fleas

customer_reviews.title: The affordable one
customer_reviews.text: This one being effective against both fleas & ticks covers my 2 cats for 3 months, & I'll get another then to cover the remainder of the summer. Far more affordable than the name-brand option costing 3x more.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Guy

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Our cat is now on her death bed after treating her with this. I used this on her last year with no side effects so I figured it was ok. Shes lethargic. It looks as if shes had a stroke. She cant walk straight. Shes limping and going in a circle. I blame this flea and trick treatment for doing this to her. DO NOT BUY. THIS IS HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Mommaof3boys

customer_reviews.title: Save Money And Get This!  Works better then the high priced ones!  =)
customer_reviews.text: Pet Armor works just as well if not a little better then the name brands. NO allergic reaction to any of our 5 cats. No burns, no scratching, no nothing. I don't know what is up with all the topical flea treatments lately, but none seem to work as well as they used to. I've tried several and even the well known name brands and none of the name brand works either. (Frontline, etc) Save your money on the big name brands and try this one. It has worked better then the others.
customer_reviews.author: H. Martin

customer_reviews.title: No twitchy dying fleas but oh well
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this from another generic product that worked well but wasn't lasting anywhere near as long as advertised (1-2 weeks instead of a month and then they'd come back with a grudge). I'm glad I tried this one next, It's been around 3 weeks and still no fleas to be found! I just ordered the dog one too. The only thing that worried me at first was that unlike the other one the fleas weren't instantly visibly dying.. But hey, I don't like watching twitchy dying fleas crawl off of my cats anyway haha.
customer_reviews.author: Snowyjake

customer_reviews.title: Do not use!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely so not use. Made my cats hair fall out and gave him sores.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Of 3

customer_reviews.title: A+  Mercy for fleas!
customer_reviews.text: I may have accidentally clicked "one star" but this is a five star product!! The only people that will disagree with me are murderous anti-fleaists. Petarmor is sold under the guise of flea eradication, but mercifully lets the fleas live! Think of all those fleas that would have been subjected to genocide that now get to live and have families! Not to mention your pet can learn to live in harmony with nature and all it's surroundings as it becomes used to the constant biting, blood-sucking and non-stop irritation at the bite sites. Please, please buy this product, and join in the fair treatment of our parasitic brothers and sisters.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: ... used this product before and it is just as good as the more expensive brands ~ and better priced
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product before and it is just as good as the more expensive brands ~ and better priced!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda G.

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: always order this for my cats.Used to get at Walmart, but find it is cheaper at amazon. I live in the woods with a lot of deer and a lot of ticks. I find very few if any ticks on them. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: hoody

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Customer
customer_reviews.text: Never had any problems with Pet Armor for my two kitties. They never had any reactions or anything. I'm sure just like people, every cat will react differently to chemicals. Thankfully my cats don't have bougie skin! As for the fleas, the first time I used this brand was because I found fleas on them (they were newly adopted kittens) and it worked. I did it for 3 months and bye bye fleas. Also vacuumed and treated the house just in case! Now I use it just to keep the fleas away - it is summer and I been working outside a lot so I don't want to bring in any unwanted visitors! Very good price and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nocito family

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA and cheaper than European original Fipronil product.
customer_reviews.text: Kitty thanks American generic drug maker Perrigo for making a generic equivalent product in USA to compete with the overpriced Merial/Frontline product made in France. The applicator in the PetArmor product is easier to use and more effective. It is also less sticky than Frontline, so our cat is less bothered. PetArmor is like having your cake and eating it too, without ticks and fleas!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my cats at all
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on my 4 cats for a few months, and I am very disappointed. I kept hoping it would work once the flea life cycle ended-but my cats all still had fleas. After a few months, I went to my vet to purchase a prescription topical (that also protects against heart worm in cats-unlike this product)--which worked within a day to eradicate all signs of fleas. I wish I hadn't wasted money on PetArmor Plus for cats and had just purchased flea treatment/preventative straight from my vet to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Vet. says do not use. Not returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Before using, consulted veterinarian. "Do not use"! was her response, rare but some reports of chemical burns. Not returnable even if unopened.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Worked well!!
customer_reviews.text: Cats had gotten fleas but this made them vanish. Was afraid to try an inexpensive brand of topical flea medication but this stuff compares very well to brands such as frontline. Did not cause my cats any rashes or hair loss. Fleas were gone within 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat an allergic reaction to it
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a reaction to it and has a bald spot. He didn’t have flees and never has but uses this for the first time a week ago and today noticed a bald irritated spot on him. Looks like it’s the closet he can reach to where the medicine was but on :(.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, and less money!
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Very pleased. My cat showed no evidence of any irritation OR annoyance from the application! His scratching improved on the first day and totally in about a week or so. This was my 1st purchase and I just placed another order today.
customer_reviews.author: gregg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Edit: My cat got fleas while using this product so I changed to Advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Anneliese Hohmeier

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work the second dose
customer_reviews.text: I thought since it had the same ingredients as Frontline plus, that it would work as well as Frontline plus. Well, it doesn't. The scientist in me wonders why. The carrier? Maybe the specs are off. I don't know. I just know that the first dose knocked the fleas down, but midway through the second month, the fleas were back. Fudged a bit and administered the third montly dose a week short of the month, and it did nothing. Very disappointed.,and confused.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN REVOLUTION IN MY OPINION
customer_reviews.text: This product is cheaper here than at Walmart by an average of 10.00. I have used it twice now and it has eradicated the fleas exactly like it said it would. It took no time at all for my cats to stop scratching, freaking out, and jumping on the furniture to get away from the floor. It is definitely worth the money you pay.
customer_reviews.author: Never Pay Full Price

customer_reviews.title: It works for all six cats I give it to!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this product gets terrible reviews. I use a vet prescribed medication for my indoor cats and I buy Pet Armor for six outdoor cats that hang out on my porch (because I feed them lol). This product is affordable for my situation and the cats are flea free and healthy. I've been using it on all 6 for 3 months after they infested my porch. Haven't had a problem since. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Toulajit

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as Frontline Plus
customer_reviews.text: This product works as described... kills ticks and fleas on our three cats. We have a large lot, and an indoor/outdoor cat who refuses to remain indoors so he brings in ticks (usually dead) on his fur sometimes. We walk the other two cats on leashes for 20-40 minutes each day. I've alternately used Frontline Plus and was scared to keep using this due to reviews in which others say this product has affected their cat's health. So I watch mine closely for a few days after application. After using it multiple times, no worries (crossing fingers). It contains the same ingredients as Frontline Plus.
customer_reviews.author: millergal

customer_reviews.title: ... rid of and keep the bites away for a great price. During the summer months I apply once ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works well to get rid of and keep the bites away for a great price. During the summer months I apply once a month, the winter/wet months seems to require less frequent applications. Be sure to spread the medicine in a large circle on their neck, otherwise you might burn the skin and lose some hair, which I’ve noticed all brands do (I have a small cat and sometimes she doesn’t even need the full dose).
customer_reviews.author: Ann B.

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely NO TICKS OR FLEAS THIS LAST MONTH! I have used Frontline for several years. Always found several ticks. I have three outdoor/indoor cats. I want to live with my cats and not ticks and fleas! Also what I like is that my cats did not respond as if their skin was irritated. The packaging is so much easier to deal with. Yes I will buy again! One other note... this product dries quickly, does not stay oily like the Frontline.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyRose

customer_reviews.title: I basically bought fleas.
customer_reviews.text: Used this brand from my Amazon purchase as well as a box locally for a few months to give it a chance. Seriously just didn't work at all for our household. Shortly after switching from Frontline fleas appeared like this junk was pest crack. I thought maybe something else had changed in our household or property but nope... Just an awful product for us. After switching to a prescribed treatment and then back to Frontline, fleas are gone again but it took time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Easy to apply and it seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gene H

customer_reviews.title: Fleas are getting comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions and still the fleas can be seen jumping on the cat. In the end I took the cat to the vet and spent more $ on another treatment. I guess I had bad luck with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Used to be my go-to. No more.  Like water.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use PetArmor for all three of our cats. It smelled awful to them and they didn't like it being put on, but it worked very well. Ticks were gone, fleas were gone. No longer. They must have changed the formula a couple years ago as it now looks and acts like plain water. The cats are indifferent about it and it does nothing, absoliutely nothing, to keep ticks or fleas away from the cats. I'm moving on. Don't waste your money. It went form excellent to worthless, probably because of a new forumla someone at the company thought they could use to save some money. Yeah, well, I'll save MY money, too. Bye bye.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech

customer_reviews.title: Killed ALL the ticks and fleas on a feral cat!
customer_reviews.text: Had a feral cat come in from the cold and we let her have the garage. Hopefully she’s a good mouser. :-) She had at least 7 ticks around her neck and ears (and who knows how many elsewhere) and fleas of course. Put 1 of the applications on her and waited. By day 3 all the ticks were dead and shrinking in size. By the end of the first week they were gone and there’s no sign of fleas. I really didn’t expect one application to do the job but man, it got the job done. This is great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: whyNOTme

customer_reviews.title: ,........... minus 5 stars if possible..waste of my $$ & made cat sick! WTF???!.a refund due??
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work but , my cat "varmit" has patches of his hair on his butt and back falling out,itches a lot ,rolling around on his back in dirt/puked trying to get rid of it...with in a day or 2 of applying, WTF.?.. let varmit inside house & he left a large bunch of fur on carpet.have applied similar flea,tick stuff before w/o any problems...to bad i purchased the 6 mo. supply...kinda scared to try again next month! ... talked a vet..she said NO....do not use this brand has made other cats sick also ... maybe die! spend couple bucks more for advantage multi, it's safer
customer_reviews.author: john wunder

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I tried Pet Armor Plus after noticing the standard Pet Armor wasn't doing as much as it used to. 6 doses for about $30, not a bad deal. Unfortunately, this stuff is just about as useless as the regular Pet Armor. For the record, I have an indoor cat in a detached house with no carpets, no throw rugs, no other pets. I think the fleas are adapting and are more resistant to fipronil. I'm calling it quits with Pet Armor, I'd rather give the cat a bath with dish soap.
customer_reviews.author: Grace T.

customer_reviews.text: Price was right but I'll tell you,, having my doubts about pet Armor s quality. Our dog was like a flea farm and one treatment of Frontline and not a flea in a week. I have four house cats and I dosed them with the pet Armor and for the entire month they scratched, actually had a breakout in the house during the month of treatment. Could be something else I know,,but the question is still there. Save 20 bucks and scratch or spend it and feel safe about the pets and us.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ford

customer_reviews.title: Protects wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: Works as good as the expensive name brand...same exact stuff & quantity same. A lot cheaper. Works on our kitty. She's an outside cat & I hardly ever see her scratching or shaking her head. Never see any fleas or ticks on her either. It helps too that I put stuff on my lawn that kills & prevents fleas & ticks, as we live in the country & every dog & cat from here to Egypt comes through our yard with all their fleas & ticks, while they make their little poop presents & sprays everywhere. We need ALL the help we can get & this product works above and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mc

customer_reviews.title: This actually seems to work as well as Frontline Plus on my cat
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that this was a knock-off type brand that might either irritate my cats skin or just plain not work. I've been using it for 2 months (in peak tick season) and he hasn't had nearly as many on him as he normally would, AND it's been a wet spring (so would normally be worse than usual). He still gets a few here and there, but compared to FLPlus it's actually doing a better job.
customer_reviews.author: JLD

customer_reviews.title: Great flea treatment at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, good price, and the vials aren't so full that the medicine drips all over. The fact that there is just enough medicine in each vial to do the job means I can dose even my most fidgety cat with ease. It doesn't stink, it isn't greasy, and it works very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzyedges

customer_reviews.title: Used to use other brand name. Got 8 cats ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to use other brand name. Got 8 cats, and this is much cheaper. 1 cat had tick (eweee) on ear, put on the pet armor and within a hour the tick was gone and my cats stopped scratching (fleas).
customer_reviews.author: Bosslady

customer_reviews.title: Does not kill fleas.
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 full grown cats and one of them got fleas. Tried this product on all 5. The fleas just got worse and 10 days later they all had some fleas and I dosed them all again. The fleas were not multiplying but they sure weren't dead. I bought the top brand at the store. Starts with A and ends in 2. The fleas were dead an hour later and the cats are comfortable again. This product might work on a kitten to keep them off but I had a light infestation and it did not work. I hate putting all this chemical on my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Bartak

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as Advantage
customer_reviews.text: I have used Frontline and Advantage before. I generally get the ex large dog size and divide it down for use on the cats. We live in the Midwest so fleas are an issue from spring til first frost, or prolonged cool (March/April thru Sept./October). I tried it out on a couple of the cats and used the advantage on the other 2. It works as well as the advantage for less. It's less likely to cause skin irritation than the advantage. I may be ordering more, as Summer isn't quite done here.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the name brand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my furbabies because I was a little tight on cash for the summer, I decided to buy a cheaper flea topical medicine other than what I normally get from the Vet. For the price, I couldn't resist. But works? Well, I see in some reviews it worked for them, but for my two cats, didn't help at all, in fact, it didn't work to what I was hoping that I had to spend more money and go to the vet afterwards. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone but if you can't afford the high brand product, I guess this can work if you have no other option, but for me, I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good working med for fleas and ticks and lice....great pruce for a 6 pack and it works !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product...same as Frontline. Cintrols/kills ticks and fleas abd lice. Sum fkea products fo not kill ticks...ticks are rather new as far as infestations. So its neccisary...I had an inside cat get a huge tick...so wether inside or out I'd recommend this product that does kill them. Good price for 6 tubes...adds up to about 6 bucks per tube verses most are 10.00 to 12.00 now...up to 20.00 for Revolution per tube. I have used this med for many yrs....with no issues at all. Its a great deal...got it fast too....
customer_reviews.author: Pam King

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, it works!
customer_reviews.text: So after a bit of research on what’s the best active ingredients for killing fleas safely without spending a fortune, I came across this product. I took in my niece’s cat that she’d been recently letting outside, and it got fleas. Pretty bad too. He’s also a very long haired cat, I should mention. I applied the product and within the first 25 hours noticed pretty much no fleas in him anywhere. I gave it an extra day before allowing him to run around the house and my other 2 cats. Didn’t see any on him. It’s now been about 2 weeks and everything is still looking good. No bad reactions or sickness. Highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Potratz

customer_reviews.title: if not BETTER, it also has a pleasant scent
customer_reviews.text: PetArmor 3 Count Plus for Cats Flea and Tick Squeeze-On, 1.5 lb. is has the exact same ingredients as Frontline Plus while performing AS WELL, if not BETTER, it also has a pleasant scent. I can not say the same about Frontline Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lily & Mary's GaGa

customer_reviews.title: It worked for Pretty-Kitty!  Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this product's effectiveness, but used it on a stray cat that I wanted to bring in to become a house cat before winter. He had many different types of ticks on him that needed to be removed first. I applied the product as prescribed, two days later, I combed out his fur and found no live ticks! We live in a very wooded area and this was a huge relief. Pretty-Kitty is now a fat, happy (albeit newly neutered) house cat.
customer_reviews.author: Back2Future

customer_reviews.title: Works well for our kitties. They're indoor only but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for our kitties. They're indoor only but we also have a dog, and we don't want any hitchhikers infesting the place!
customer_reviews.author: Attack HamsterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff that the cats hate but owners love.
customer_reviews.text: Good supply and price. A bit difficult to open. My baby cat(well she still thinks she’s a baby:) knows the sound of the flea medicine. These are a bit more difficult to open than some brands so if you struggle with hand issues or what not it might be best to try another brand that has the twist off option. Even still—the medication is efficient. Speak with your vet prior to introducing a new medication for your fur children young and old.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed to be working as I could see fleas jumping off of cats and literally dying where I could never see fleas on them. But didn’t last past a week. I have had pets all my life - I’m 68 - and know to constantly vac and wash floors, bedding and everything in house. Instead of flea population growing smaller it is getting worse. Am now having to use commercial grade sprays to try and get fleas under control. This treatment appears to be useless.
customer_reviews.author: oldIT

customer_reviews.title: Tick and Flea
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this with hopes it would rid my cats of fleas. It didn't. I since have gotten rid of them by using an alternative. I am still using Petarmor as it has six applications and the fleas have since gone. I probably won't purchase again. However to be fair, I also had purchased the 8 month Seresto collar and it did nothing to stop the fleas. And that is the third one I have purchased. I honestly think the fleas had such a foothold , a collar or the liquid application couldn't put a dent in it. What I did buy got rid of everything within a couple of days. Ronda C
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Gasparovic Chimera

customer_reviews.title: It tried it's best, but wasn't strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on all three of my cats. It only worked on two, and by the time they were due for their next application all three had fleas again. With all the precautions taken keeping my house clean to keep them flea free, AND the being strictly indoor cats, they still ended up spreading fleas around. The upsides were: no strong odor, easy application, no unwanted side effects. The downside is, from my Vet's mouth, a lot of "off" brand products aren't working anymore. I believe this would be a decent product for a smaller cat in a one pet home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK- might actually make cat sick
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this if you're trying to go the cheaper route in place of Frontline, i tried it and for the fist time I've seen fleas on my cats. Plus one of my cats lost her appetite, and the other one is having urinary issues, not sure if that is a coincidence but i would stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Marcantonio

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has had fleas soo bad and ibe been so so desperate to get him relief and rid him and my house of the fleas! I tried flea collar that claimed it would get rid of 95% in 24 hours and didnt seem to touch them. I put a dose of this on him and he went crazy for a few hours but now seems to have NO fleas crawling on him in less than 48 hours!! I'm going to comb him to make sure but if this is how well it works, I'll be treating him with this every month!!! No more fleas for us!!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not sure it worked
customer_reviews.text: All my pets are indoor only! Have been treating for fleas for two months and using capstar pills along with PetArmor for cats and I also use the one for dogs. Capstar kills instantly for 4 hours so not sure why we still have fleas. The traps I ordered are getting filled up and I just ordered two more. I’m getting some DE today and will use tomorrow after I steam shampoo carpets today. All rugs and blankets etc have been washed. No clue why this isn’t working!
customer_reviews.author: BarefootMostly

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: It didn't seem to kill or prevent fleas on our cats, even after giving them capstar (which kills live fleas on cats for 24 hours) and spraying carpet and furniture of home with knockout prior to the applications. But I can say the same thing about Revolution, which is prescribed by our vet and costs a lot more. Fortunately, none of the cats showed any adverse reaction to the treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: Better than some and affordable
customer_reviews.text: It's cheaper than frontline and it works ok. I never have any problems with this for my dog, but for some reason, my cat still gets fleas on her toward the end of the cycle. I can't say that they are surviving on her too long, but I have found them on her. She's indoor/outdoor and when she goes out, she like to get into the bushes. I'm sure the fact she's hiding out in shrubbery isn't helping any. It's better than other cheap brands I've tried and I can't smell any chemical odor.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, and they spend very little time outside. In the past, fleas haven't been much of an issue, but the recent addition of a long hair cat has made it easier for fleas to hop a ride into the house. I was hopeful that PetArmor would be an effective alternative to higher priced options, but alas, this is not the case. I'm giving three stars only because I cannot say with certainty that PetArmor had no effect; however, all three cats continued to scratch, and there was no visible period of relief.
customer_reviews.author: Mawrtyr

customer_reviews.title: My cat is mostly an indoor pet but I take ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is mostly an indoor pet but I take him in the yard sometimes. I was hoping that I wouldn't have to spend a lot of money on flea drops, so I tried these. After 3 weeks, the cat still has fleas. Not as many as before treatment, but still enough to be bothersome. I give 2 stars because there are significantly fewer fleas than before, but still not working to my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Loonytoons66

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because Cheristin and Revolution were too expensive. I won't waste my money on it again. Doesn't do a good job and doesn't last. I gave one of my cats 2 doses and she still has fleas. Also, it's ridiculously hard to unwrapt the little plastic capsule. Cheristin and Revolution are the best. If you can't get one of those get Advantage by Bayer. At least it's better than Pet Armor.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Kills fleas and keep them from coming back.
customer_reviews.text: I have cats, and cats get fleas. This stuff is readily easy to apply and both kills the fleas and keeps them from coming back. My one suggestion is this, when you open the applier, use scissors to round the edges. That way you can apply it onto the cat's skin rather than losing it in their fur. I usually brush the cat first and then as I brush I slip the applier against their skin and squeeze. Of course the cat notices and glares at me, but they're protected for a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: KMacK

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst product for my pets ever DO NOT BOTHER, you are caught between a rock and a boulder!! My cats never got rid of anything Fleas were all over the forehead with visible blood when you start to clean the area! My one older cat had chewing lice that never helped at ALL!! He just passed away and I believe the lice killed him!! Hey camera
customer_reviews.author: Anna gorlow

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. Still have fleas!
customer_reviews.text: I have the worst case of flea that I can’t seem to get under control. Once I think I may be making headway I see more fleas. I treated two of my cats with this to no aval. I would not recommend this product from this retailer. It does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Frontline
customer_reviews.text: I know many vets Frontline is their recommendation. I have tried that on my cat and the smell is just truly toxic and does not subside for over a week. I even wondered if it was burning my cat's skin. This brand is much more pleasant smelling, and the smell goes away after less than 2 days. I have not had any problems with it being less effective.
customer_reviews.author: MollyRDH

customer_reviews.title: Adverse reaction
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my cat and she was immediately irritated. I have used other brands which she tolerated fine, but this one she kept trying to scratch the area and roll on the ground to get it off. She became lethargic and acted like she didn't feel well for about 24 hours. Won't use again.
customer_reviews.author: kwallace

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work!
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work on my cats. The fleas in this area of Ohio must now be immune to whatever the active ingredient is because I've had these before and they did work in the past. This pack didn't even give them a day's relief, and then they had to wait a full 30 days longer before they could have a dose of another brand of flea protection.
customer_reviews.author: Laure J

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars because this stuff smells terrible but works great
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because this stuff smells terrible but works great. I used this for both my cats who go outside for an hour or less a day. The only reason why I put this on their fur in the summers is because I live in Colorado and theres ALOT of fleas when it gets warm. (and ticks??) I feel better than they have some protection. I don't use it year round though due to the questionable cases that have happened to some people resulting in their pets health being affected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price quality ect🐈
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cat 🐈 mr toes ,he got a few hot spots on his back and losein fur so iam useing this along wit a pill for skin therpy.will update 1/16/20 😎🐈 mr toes is great hair coming back fleas gone plus I started a skin therapy from Amazon with this 1/2 for 4 months Amazon save me a trip to the vet and lotta 💰 money. Like always if you research you will be successful here on Amazon the greatest website in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bennett AKA the bug man

customer_reviews.title: Worked and killed the fleas, kept them from coming back
customer_reviews.text: I had really good luck with this. I built my inside cats a "catio" so that they can safely go outdoors. I thought I was keeping the catio free of fleas with home pest spray but it wasn't enough and our flea free cat family became infested. One treatment for each cat was all it took to get rid of them, well along with washing all bedding to make sure. I put it on them once a month now and we haven't had a re-infestation.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna A

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper but Worth It?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it was a bit cheaper than Advantage. I had to fight a major problem with Fleas. You have to fight them full on! Which I have done and won before. I bought this Product because it was cheaper. I've been using it every two weeks and it's still not killing the fleas on my dog, so I'm going back to a better brand. Maybe after the fleas are back under control I might use this Brand for maintenance. It did help a bit, but not enough
customer_reviews.author: EasyToPlease

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst flea treatment I’ve ever used!!! I gave it a very fair shot using the entire package before leaving a review. While it is easy to use, it’s completely ineffective. I used the first 2 treatments on my grown cat and the last of the three on my little 10 week old kitten and it didn’t even work on her. As far as value for money-I’m sorely disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Libby Gardner

customer_reviews.title: It works and is not as costly as other brands
customer_reviews.text: This product keeps the fleas off of my cat. He's hasn't had an adverse reaction (skin irritation, etc) from it. It's priced better than the competitors. I usually buy the 6 pack and mark the individual vials with the month when I'll use them to remind me. Well, I also have a calendar notification because remember to do this every month is tricky. Ready for flea season! Onward and outside!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by 12 furbabies!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a bad flea season this year and our 12 babies are indoor babies. But didn't have the money to shell out over $120.00. Read a few reviews and finally based getting this item on a Consumer Reports article. Glad I did! 2 boxes of 6 cost $30 and boy did it work. Started to work almost immediately and continued to kill the fleas on them for about 24-48 hours later. Now they are ALL flea, tick free and have not seen anything but dead fleas.,I have no doubt that this item will continue to do as promised. VERY VERY HAPPY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Flea & Tick treatment
customer_reviews.text: PetArmour is a great flea & Tick treatment. It has no smell, so my cat doesn't object to it. It has proved very effect for us in NC, It is MUCH more affordable than other products. My cat is an indoor cat but goes out to our dog kennel through an indoor/outdoor dog door. The kennel ground is covered with gravel. Fleas can reproduce at 45 degrees!
customer_reviews.author: jrobink

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for me
customer_reviews.text: This didn't kill my cat's fleas and I ended up having to buy Frontline from my vet anyway. Don't waste your money if you have issues with fleas. My vet confirmed this product usually works well for ticks, however.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel KN

customer_reviews.title: It works great at first
customer_reviews.text: Here we are, 2 weeks after application and I just found a flea on my cat...my solely indoor cat. It works great at first, but it definitely hasn't lasted a month on any application. I wish I could give it 2 1/2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Keepee

customer_reviews.title: Some fleas are now resistant
customer_reviews.text: This product was used as directed. It does not kill all the fleas. Some are resistant. Vet also not recommending this. Now I have to spend money again to get more the reliable flea killer from vet. I had hoped it would work because it was cheaper, but in the world of fleas killing most of the fleas and not all is still not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: ineffective
customer_reviews.text: fleas return after two weeks. the vet says Advantage II and Frontline Plus (PetArmor Plus) no longer work here in Northern California, and after trying both, I believe her. she advises Cherestin or possibly Seresto collar and that's what I am going to try next. I was going to try Catego but I noticed that while it basically had the same percentages of insecticide as Vectra, the Catego vial only contained about half as much material.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The effect on the skin
customer_reviews.text: The packet was easy to open and the product was easy to put together and use. The most important feature was the effect of the product on the skin and its effectiveness. The product has a soothing effect on the skin. I immediately felt a reduction in the irritation caused by the flees that my cat brought from outside. The effect was obvious on the cat, too, as it reduced the fits of mad scratching of her skin.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if the fleas became immune to this product but after using it on my cats for several months it became less and less effective. My cats were constantly scratching. This month I finally switched to the more expensive Advantage II. Advantage contains different ingredients and it is killing fleas. Happier cats, happier me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst tick preventive on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless. Within days of switching to this brand, my cat began gathering countless ticks. It does not prevent, kill or reduce the number of live ticks, period. This brand is definitely one to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, cheaper than Frontline
customer_reviews.text: Saw a lot of reviews that said this product doesn't work; Fipronil works better for prevention and has a tendency to induce resistance, so be careful how you use it. This product has worked well for us- 3 cats, 1 dog, to eliminate fleas over a the last 3 months. If you have a heavy infestation, you still need to wash everything, vacuum every day, etc, or the problem won't go away. Capstar (or generic nitenpyram) will help.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works well on cats
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well for our 2 cats for the last 2 years., Once a month for 3 months (June, July, August) this is applied to our cats who go into the wooded area behind our house. We check them when they enter the house and have only found 1 tick this year. I have not seen any side effects on health.
customer_reviews.author: G Customer

customer_reviews.title: I always used advantage 2 on my cats. Now ...
customer_reviews.text: I always used advantage 2 on my cats. Now I have one that loses his fur with advantage. It also must itch cuz he scratches which makes it scab and of course keep lossing fur. It takes at least a month to heal. I tried this as an alternative and it works just as well with no side effects. Not to mention the price is so much less.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this on our cats, it worked great. The second time, not so much. It almost felt as if we had received two different products. Our indoor/outdoor kitty ended up with fleas and ear mites after the second box of this flea medication failed to fully work.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Great price and it works
customer_reviews.text: I love the price and you get 6 in the box. I have 4 pets - 2 cats and 2 dogs - and have to get 3 boxes at a time bc they are different weights., so being able to get a product that works at this price is great. Been using this brand for years, use to get it at Costco. Glad to find it here at this price.
customer_reviews.author: MoTown

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just administered this on my cat and her 4 kittens last night and already noticed some dead fleas on them. They’re already more playful and loving- mama still seems a bit down and miserable so I’ll be keeping an eye on her. Great value for the money, I was able to give everyone a treatment and have a spare for the month just in case mama needs a second dose. So far no noticeable hair loss or reactions aside from mama’s energy picking up as much as the little ones. Although she might just be mad that I won’t let her out!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Half and Half
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flea treatment as long as someone does not have a cat with sensitive skin. This flea treatment worked on all of my cats, but one. The treatment made his whole body break out in scabs so, again, I would not recommend this flea treatment to a person with a cat who has sensitive skin, but I would recommend it to someone with a cat without sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Thornley

customer_reviews.title: We have used this product on our 6 lb. ...
customer_reviews.text: We have used this product on our 6 lb. cat for the last six months. She's an outdoor cat, and so far no signs of fleas or ticks.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: I went for the cheaper product this time and it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I went for the cheaper product this time and it just doesn't work. The product description states it has the same ingredients as the leading product. I can't comment on that, but this product had no effect on the fleas of my cats; not a bit! I got 5 cats and their weight is between 6.5 and 7.5 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: It burned my cats fur, caused scabs
customer_reviews.text: On 2 out of 3 of my cats it was fine, but I will never use this product on my Russian Grey again. His skin went bare, he still has scabs on it from over 2 months ago. You get what you pay for, and this DOES NOT work the same as Frontline Plus which I had used successfully many times before
customer_reviews.author: hookbill

customer_reviews.title: Same as more expensive Frontline!
customer_reviews.text: Same as more expensive Frontline! Great price! CVC drugs store wanted $29 for this, while Walmart asked for $25. So for $20 this is the best price I could find by far! Works in about a day to rid your cat of fleas, etc. You get 3 applications that last for 30 days each. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Flea and Tick Preventative.
customer_reviews.text: I applied this product approx. 3 weeks ago. Saw fleas on each of our two kitties before treatment but none now. Will treat again in about a week. The product is packaged by weight of the cat. Know your cat's weight and purchase accordingly. Easy to apply. Simply open one tube and apply to your cat as directed. Treat every 30 days to maintain a flea-free kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Renae Ely

customer_reviews.title: Totally inneficient against fleas and got my cat sick!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly USSELES and DANGEROUS product, it shouldn't even be on the market!!! Not only that it doesn't get rid of ANY fleas (in fact they seems to multiply faster), but one of our cats, 2 years old healthy male got sick for couple of days, stop eating and beeing letargic because of this crap!!! I regret I didn't read the reviews before. We got the package of 6 for our three cats for a 2 months treatment, but I will just throw at the garbage the rest of them and get a good and efficient product for few bucks more Don't waist your money on this crap!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Howard Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Effective and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I've used this for at least 4 years with good results. I live in a climate that never gets cold enough to kill off the flea population so they can be a year round problem. The smell isn't objectionable and it doesn't leave an oily residue. Two of my cats begrudgingly accept its application, because cats. The third throws an epic tantrum but that's just how she is about anything that isn't her idea.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Ives

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated that this doesn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this product immensely. Our indoor/outdoor cat gets at least 2 ticks a day after being treated with this product the way I was directed on the instructions. I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to leave bad reviews but I actually want a refund for this product. It arrived and we put it on the cats there was literally no change except some scratching. It was like we put sugar water on the cats. We waited a day or two and actually retreated our oldest cat and still NOTHING!! This product is horrible. We have now ordered Frontline and it will be in today. Just save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: garbage!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOPE!!!!! I only saw a couple fleas on my cat so I decided to get this early nip it in the butt. It was useless! The fleas have gotten worse. What a waste of $30. I wish I would have just went with Advantage or Frontline!!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mixologist

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: This product did absolutely nothing to control fleas on any of my 6 indoor cats. I was a couple weeks late treating my dog this year and he managed to bring fleas into the house. I've used this product 2 months in a row on my indoor only cats and it hasn't done anything. The dog, who goes out constantly, is on regular Frontline+ and he's had no issues with fleas all summer. The cats scratch constantly and are covered in flea dirt.
customer_reviews.author: P.S.

customer_reviews.title: Do you want fleas? This is how you get fleas
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. My poor cat is being eaten alive. I had been using frontline prior to treating him with this product this month and he was fine. Two weeks after being treated with this product his neck and head are riddled with scabs and bites. He’s scratching like crazy. It’s even more frustrating because since he was dosed with the chemicals of this product I feel like I need to wait to retreat him with a product that actually works. I hate giving negative reviews but I’m infuriated that this product caused my baby so much harm. Seriously, this medication is horrible it does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Logan P

customer_reviews.title: WORKED WELL ON MY 2 CATS OTHER PRODUCTS DID NOT
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE TRIED ALL DIFFERENT SPOT ON PRODUCTS THIS 2018 SEASON. MOST LASTED ONLY A FEW DAYS, OR NO HELP AT ALL , TO 2 WEEKS. THIS PRODUCT DID NOT WORK OVERNIGHT BUT TOOK 3 DAYS TO FULLY KICK IN. MY 2 CATS SEEM COMFORTABLE, AND THE SCRATCHING HAS ALMOST CEASED. I WOULD RECOMMEND PETARMOR IF YOU ARE HAVING A DIFFICULT FLEA SEASON WITH YOUR PETS.
customer_reviews.author: making it in mass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about six months on my multiple felines. It works very well, doesn't seem to have any side effects. Happy healthy cats and much better price than the competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Protected my cat from fleas?? Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Well,it didn't work for my domestic short hair (indoor cat). Administed on July 6, 2020 and he got fleas about weeks later. Only place he was at was the vet for his annual check up/shots (clean bill of heath). Either way...didn't work for any sort of preventative measures. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: DarkStarz

customer_reviews.title: I See Fleas !
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about 3 months. I applied monthly, directly to my cats back neck on the skin. I still can see occasional fleas crawling thru his fur when petting him. If I can see one or two through his thin hair by his ears, than I can be almost certain there are many more. I want them dead. Changing to something hopefully better. My cat is an only pet, mostly indoor cat with daily outdoor leash walks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Honaker

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: The feline furball somehow caught fleas. The vet recommended this, as the furball is allergic to most other treatment options. It works for the furball w/ no adverse reactions. You do have to make sure to reapply every 30 Days. Product arrived earlier than expected. ...as soon as it was applied, it started working.
customer_reviews.author: Elizqeth

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. My dog had bad fleas and gave them to my cat. Not only did it kill the fleas but it prevented more of them . Happy customer right here!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy yates

product_meta.title: PETARMOR Plus Flea & Tick Prevention for Cats with Fipronil, Waterproof, Long-Lasting & Fast-Acting Topical Cat Flea Treatment
product_meta.description: Size:6 COUNTYour pets are family, and PETARMOR helps you confidently care for your pet especially when it comes to flea and tick control. PETARMOR PLUS Flea and Tick Prevention for Cats conveniently provides vet-quality protection without the expense of a vet visit. It kills fleas, flea eggs, flea larvae, and ticks for up to 30 days. This flea & tick topical treatment for cats controls mites that may cause sarcoptic mange and kills deer ticks that may transmit Lyme disease, while preventing flea infestation for up to 4 weeks. Fast-acting, waterproof, and containing the same active ingredients as Frontline Plus for Cats, this flea & tick treatment for cats starts to work quickly and effectively. To apply, remove 1 product tube, cut off the top, and use the open end to part your cat's hair. Squeeze the tube firmly so that all of the solution is applied to your cat's skin between the shoulder blades. If the fur around the area still looks greasy 48 hours after application, use a wet washcloth to remove any excess product. Keep treated pets apart from each other, other pets, and children for 24 hours, until the product has time to dry completely.
feature_bullets: EFFECTIVE, WATERPROOF FLEA TREATMENT FOR CATS: PetArmor Plus is a fully waterproof, flea & tick topical prevention for cats that kills fleas, flea eggs, flea larvae, ticks, and chewing lice for up to 30 days after application.

TRUSTED, VET QUALITY FORMULA: Containing the same active ingredients as Frontline Plus for Cats, PetArmor Plus for Cats has a powerful formula that begins killing fleas within 24 hours of application.

BREAK THE FLEA CYCLE: Unlike other flea and tick treatments that may just kill adult fleas, PETARMOR Plus Cat Flea Treatment works by breaking the flea life cycle. Kills flea eggs and larvae for up to 12 weeks.

FLEA AND TICK PROTECTION: PetArmor Plus for Cats protects your furry family member from brown dog ticks, American dog ticks, Lone Star ticks, and deer ticks (which may transmit Lyme disease). The product will begin to kill fleas within about 12 hours of contact with your cat. It may take closer to 48 hours to begin to kill ticks
LONG-LASTING: This flea and tick treatment comes with six (6) 0.017 fl. oz. Waterproof topical applications totaling three months of flea protection for your pet.
